article.headline: Pacific 79, San Francisco 72
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Steffan Johnson scored a career-high 23 points, and Pacific defeated the University of San Francisco 79-72 in the nonconference game Wednesday night. Michael White had 15 points, Anthony Brown scored 13 and Anthony Esparza scored 11 for the Tigers (3-3), who snapped a two-game losing streak. Armondo Surratt had 16 points and a game-high six assists for USF (3-4). Alan Wiggins Jr. had 14 points, Antonio Kellogg scored 13 and Jay Watkins also scored in double figures for the Dons with 10. Johnson, a sophomore guard who also had four steals and six rebounds, sliced through the USF defense for two layups to give Pacific a 52-41 lead with 12 minutes to play. The Dons got back within 58-54 on a fast-break dunk by Johnny Dukes with six minutes remaining, but White scored the next six points to put Pacific's advantage back to double digits, and the Tigers lead never fell below six points the rest of the way. Pacific shot 60 percent from the field in the second half and held a 32-22 rebounding edge. The Tigers made 11 of 14 free throws in the final two minutes to seal the victory. Johnson had three steals and scored 13 points in the game's first 10 minutes, as Pacific broke out to a 26-13 lead midway through the first half. USF answered with a 13-2 run sparked by Surratt, whose fast-break layup brought the Dons within 28-26. Surratt had 10 points in the final seven minutes before halftime, keeping USF within 34-29 at the break.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
